results.title: The Galapagos: Darwin's clues
results.brief_description: Shows how the variety and characteristics of the wildlife of the Galapagos Islands provided the first clues for Darwin’s theory of natural selection.

results.title: Future shock
results.creator_credit: Alex Grasshoff and Metro Media Corporation
results.brief_description: Examines the current phenomenon of future shock, the condition which results from too much change too fast. Current technological developments are presented through interviews with scientists. The film echoes Alvin Toffler’s questioning of whether or not change is necessary, and if it is out of control.

results.title: The Future of one million Africans
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “This Modern Age”.
A study of conditions in Bechuanaland, Basutoland, and Swaziland, the British protectorates on the borders of South Africa. The resources and products of each territory are looked at in turn. The contrast between modern ways of living and the old tribal traditions. How the problem of drought, with consequent soil erosion and deterioration is being tackled everywhere by engineering, agricultural and pastoral development. Improvements in medicine and education. How many of the natives leave the protectorates for short period to earn money in South African mines. Explains and discusses the political setup; how the High Commissioner worked with the help of Residential Commissioners and native Advisory Councils. Brief history of South African relations with the protectorates.

results.title: What's it all about
results.creator_credit: Brian Bergin, Malcolm Smith and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Further Education”.
One of a series of films which deal with the idea that our education should not stop with the end of formal studies. Claims that we must learn to accept and adapt to social change.

results.title: Three students
results.creator_credit: Brian Bergin, Malcolm Smith and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Further Education”
One of a series of films which deal with the belief that our education should not stop with formal studies at school. This film is about three adults who have undertaken adult education courses.

results.title: Designing a curriculum
results.creator_credit: Brian Bergin, Malcolm Smith and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Further Education”.
One of a series of films which deal with the idea that our education should not stop with the end of formal studies. Courses are designed to allow students to develop a balanced background in subject undertaken so that they can think creatively and flexibly about work.

results.title: Community centres
results.creator_credit: Brian Bergin, Malcolm Smith and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Further Education”.
One of a series of films which deal with the belief that our education should not stop with formal studies at school. Further education centres are located in major centres throughout South Australia. Shows some of the activities undertaken at Victor Harbour.
